Early Access Review

I originally had a positive review on the initial release, because I was biased. I expected this game to be something great when it first came out, and it DEFINITELY wasn't. After realizing that, I changed my review to be negitive, which was a good idea, considering I definitely did not recommend it at the time. But now, after playing it after V0.03, I'm seeing it improve a lot.
Upon initial release, character saves randomly got deleted, constant server crashes, there were only 2 or 3 NPC merchants, skill trees reset when you left a game, and there were floating trees and shrubs everywhere. It was horrendous, so horrendous, that the devs basically agreed.

The thing is, Syrin Studios is working their ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• off to patch it and make it as awesome as it can be. So far, people who got this game on the initial release day have seen great improvements in optimization, an increase in the amount of not only NPC merchants, but NPCs in general. We've seen a removal/fix of all floating shrubbaray, and water that you can actually swim in, as well amazing connection to their servers (The other day I was playing on a server with 150 ping that's located in the UK while I'm in NY with no problem at all). This game is improving fast, and unless they suddenly stop updating as a whole, I'm going to leave this recommendation.

Good luck Syrin Studios, you're doin' good things, keep it up. I recommend this game to people who want to invest in a game that is not only already enjoyable, but to people who want a game that is going to keep improving until it is finished.

Early Access Review

UPDATED as of V0.03 stability hotfix.
This game is STILL no where near ready for a paid EA release..

‚ñ™ House prices were increased not that it matters, they rarely save and you can forget any loot you put inside.

‚ñ™ Skills now save but XP does not.  Not that it matters, more than half the skills don't work and the crafting recipes you get with them don't produce anything when used.

‚ñ™ Combat is still an absolute desyncy mess, not to mention some people get an invincible bug.

‚ñ™ People abuse the guard AI in the city to grief and kill players.  Guards will also attack you for things like mining and hunting animals.

‚ñ™ Kind of a repeat but majority of class crafting recipes flat out don't do anything.

‚ñ™ Upgrading your class through leveling still doesn't work.

‚ñ™ Tons of inventory glitches such as infinite items, duping, selling issues.

‚ñ™ Many people still crash on launch or can't connect to any servers.

‚ñ™ For those that do get in trying to connect to a server with 20 or more people results in a kick and a mandatory game restart.

‚ñ™  Servers crash constantly, devs blame it on previous version save game files and request players to go in their game files and manually delete them.  Most players won't even see the post and not do it making servers crash constantly.

‚ñ™ Yes, player data is stored locally and there is no anti-cheat.. If this game ever becomes functional the cheaters will have a hay day.

‚ñ™ Exiting the game doesn't register on Steam half the time, so you have to manually close Steam to relaunch the game.

I understand this is an EA game, but this totally refines what EA means.  The game needs major polishing before it becomes anywhere near playable.  I will continue to test the game every patch/hotfix and update my review with it, but as of now I would NOT recommend this game.

The game has potential, they could add in the ability to craft your own furniture in the future (add/remove furniture from your home), perhaps remove the merchants high inventory space and replace it with less weight on certain items (like cotton), allows merchants to craft or buy bags that allow more inventory space, fix the housing prices since some houses are way overpriced for what they are (all houses are currently set to 2 prices), slight increase on crude weapons since they break after 1-2 resources, fix the guards who sometimes attack the person who is the victim to a slaughter rather than the person who started the assault, fix the guards since they don't attack you for stealing (they should only not attack you when you steal out of their sight), add a day/night cycle, possible classes could be (Knight, Thief, Carpenter, Baker, Butcher - really limitless classes that could be implemented in the near future), ability to buy a home and then rent it out to other players via in-game rather than RP, guards shouldn't attack you for killing animals outside the city, trying to craft a merchants tunic seems to break crafting (at least in my experience) so that would need fixing, sometimes people who jump around get stuck in a sleeping animation and that's how they'll appear walking around.

I am excited to see what this game will become, and I'm happy that I purchased the game early access because I'm capable of watching it go through all the little updates to the end product.

Early Access Review

The black death, an rpg with not a lot of content.

The black death is an early access game so I won't rant on any buggs or glitches. If I didn't want buggs I should't have bought an early access game. Allthough I will rant about a loooot of other things. First of wich will be the ''unique take on survival''.

I haven't played any hardcore survival games, but I have played some casual ones, like Rust wich I enjoy a lot and I will compare The black death to it a little. In Rust you have a food and drink bar which is easy to refill and keep a good health, yet I have found myself dying from starvation from time to time. In The Black Death you basically can't die from starvation unless you have no hands or feet to move your mouse and keyboard. It is insanely easy to stay alive.
The uniqueness must then come from the plague right? No... The plague in The Black Death should be kind of a big problem and you should need to be scared to get it, especially in the capitol. But even the people with no hand nor feet will get the plague because it's only in this tiny tiny villege in the bottom of the map. You cannot name your game ''The Black Death'' and not make people worried about getting the plague. You as a midieval peasant, merchant or militia, are never in danger of dying.

Wich brings me to the next point, classes.
There are for now 3 playable classes: the peasant, he can farm and carry a lot, the merchant who can trade and craft and the militia who can make some weapons and fight better and has more health. There are 3 more classes wich aren't available right now which are: the smith, the monk and the hunter. In an open world set in the dark ages, i would like to see  a no class system. You are a person, afraid of the plague and wanting to survive. So don't give me the bull*** of: ''you need to be a farmer if you want to plant some crops.'' But that is just a personal thing. What isn't personal is the lack of depth your character has. The abilities are very, very basic and there is no character customisation. Yeah that's right, you can't change the way your ugly face looks.

What I see in a lot of early access games is the lack of depth and content. Making a game early access is a way to let the community see what you're doing, not to show us what still needs to be done. Also I noticed more and more crowdfunded or early accecs games are focusing on 1 particular thing in their game, this time it's the plague. Being so focused on 1 thing will make the rest of the game empty and meaningless.

Yet I have not lost my hope. The graphics are pretty good and like the devs said the foundation is built. There just needs to be a lot of work done. Too much to put it in early access allready, at least that's my opinion.

For now i won't recommend buying it. Maybe wait for 3~5 months to see where the devs are then. Maybe the game will be great by then and when people read this they will get upset. I don't know. you don't know, nobody knows. That's the mystery of early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Eventually managed to get onto one of the servers after 10 minutes of trying...I remember the early days of playing ARK and DayZ, which were properly f@#ked and took weeks to resolve, so this is a massive relief by comparison.

Wow! Certainly well worth the short wait - the immersive medieval game environment is simply stunning to behold, especially for an EA title!  Big thumbs up to Unreal Engine 4, which delivers in spades incredible graphics and wonderfully fluid interactive gameplay.

It is clear the developers have played a lot of games in the survival genre, as the design bears all the hallmarks of the best titles (Rust/DayZ/LIF etc), while adding in a refreshing RPG aspect in the form of different character classes (Merchant/Peasant/Militia currently), whose skills can be enhanced over time to unlock new classes (Hunter/Blacksmith etc).  This alone has the potential to make this game HUGE and stand out from everything else in the marketplace.  I opted for Merchant to ensure I started with some gold and could immediately trade.

In addition to the usual hunger threat and being killed by marauding PvP/NPCs, there is the added risk of developing the bubonic plague which is incurable, although its progress can be slowed until your eventual death.  Respawning should allow you to inherit past items/gold, but it seems the save functionality isn't currently working - developers have said this is a priority hot fix mercifully.

Unlike in Rust where you can build and customise your own houses, this game allows you to purchase one of the many buildings already constructed and scattered across the map (cities/villages/farms/remote outhouses).  Avoid the ones marked with a red X or else you're guaranteed to catch or accelerate the plague!  The crafting options for items (food/weapons/tools/clothes etc) are richly diverse and really well thought through, requiring the player to harvest or loot the necessary base materials (food ingredients/wood/stone/cotton/animal hides etc) and locate the right equipment (anvil/oven/tannery etc) in order to transform them into more useful and valuable stuff.

You can trade items with NPCs and other players at the town marketplaces to earn gold, which I found pretty straightforward pick up.  But venturing out into the amazingly realised countryside is much more dangerous since the protection afforded by the in town militia disappears and you are more prone to being killed by ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• KOS players.  Noticed more glitches/bugs outside the city - floating grass & mystical disappearance of rivers when switching to first person viewer - but for an EA title the game environment is in fantastic shape and perhaps needs more collectible items, crafting equipment and NPCs/animals to enrich the gameplay even further.  Minor quibble!

Overall, a tremendous RPG survival game already that has all the potential of being the very best around.  Can't wait to see where the developers take it over the next few months in terms of expanding content, functionality and continuing to squish bugs.  Keep up the brilliant work!!

P.S Please make the Motion Blur a main menu setting option! :-)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

They don't call me KewlBreeze cause I'm so cool I can walk on the sun. Wait...Well, yeah, that is why!

The Black Death (Review):

$17.99 Right Now!!!

I am a player. Just like you, I wanted something to spend my time on with a small return of persistent character skills, experience and progression. The Black Death is just that kind of game. An RPG, open world, where there are few holds barred.

I woke up in a field with my hands as my only tool. I ventured off into the woods, collected some items then headed to the mountains where I knew the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• might hit the fan... it did not happen there. I became disoriented because my (M)ap did not detail where I am located nor where I might find some NPC's to check the economy.

So I wandered to a bridge, 'Capitol Bridge', and found a keep with merchants, tools, foods, utilities (for crafting) and much more. In fact, I purchased a house for $1000 coin and found a better 3 BR, 8 Storage w/Bed just down the street.

Note to self: Don't rush to buy real estate. EON.

So the game dumped me many times. The servers reset many times. I downloaded a patch (which tells me that the devs were working late (9pm EST)).

It's Alpha -this means that the entire game may change before release. With the purchase, $17.99, I have helped fund an ongoing project to release, a very interesting game, to say the least.

The exp system works. You gain exp from just about everything and can (L)earn Class Skills with those level ups. The fight mechanics are not very smooth but better than all the medeviel games out right now...surprise on that huh?

I mash an attack button (or mouse click) and the weapon moves instantly toward my target. No cheesy block moves to time...just swing, hit, kill.

The graphics are crazy! I am running in Ultra Mode without a single glitch. FPS is super-duper (for me) on a WIN10, 4Ghz, 16g, 8 Core w/390 gpu. FPS has not come up as a global chat player concern during my review.

I have heard that you can kill NPC's?!? Not verified. But, one can certainly 'steal merchandise' as you scamper through towns and such trying to survive. Inside these towns, and perhaps across the lands, Deeds can be purchased with coin from selling loot. The coinage for loot is mediocre, at best. You just won't get rich selling apples.

The game just released ALPHA and I am excited to see where it goes from here. STEAM is a great company and platform for making dreams come true for the INDIES as well as the big boys! Thanks for that STEAM.

I wish I could get paid for reviews but nah, I make too much money on my day job.

Please be patient with this one. Yes. They are working around the clock to get to Beta (which probably is not that far away). I like what they write in response to issues that arise from loads. U4 is a great engine on any network code and certainly shines in this persistent world of The Black Death.

The game is absolutely superb in its conception, potential and immersive gameplay.

Yes, there are significant connection problems, issues with saving progress and plenty of bugs all to be addressed.  But, hey that's what I expect, and have also experienced, with EA titles including other survival MMOs such as DayZ and Rust.  The developers here communicate superbly with the community and I have faith that they will address the major problems over the coming weeks, before turning their attention to balancing the gameplay and expanding out content/functionality.

What there is by way of content and gameplay currently is incredible and in the short while that I have played the game I have enjoyed it far more than other survival games.  The harsh medieval setting is depicted fantastically, while the class system allowing you to pursue one of three career paths (Merchant/Militia/Peasant) is an excellent addition that forces you modify your approach to survival.  Above the usual threats of hunger and murdered in PvP/NPC encounters, there is also the prospect of developing the plague, for which there is no cure and whose progress can only be slowed.

I loved the ability to purchase one of the many houses located in either the cities and surrounding countryside in order to store your belongings and rest up.  At the moment, there is sadly no option to build your own house, but hopefully that this will be a feature later down the line.

There is a huge area to explore across the map, with a few pointers to what might released by the developers later down the line.  I found, for example, a cave system which I could not access, but led me to think that mining might be a possibility, while the coastal port suggests the potential introduction of a fisherman class.

My one big frustration is the inability to save your progress, especially as this would counteract much of problems arising from server crashes.  Furthermore, combat is little rudimentary at present - you can choose one of three stance positions - and I'd like to see this developed out to benefit more skilled players.

Overall, despite the well documented server issues, the game is a fantastic addition to the survival genre and has all the potential to be the very best in its class given time.  Keep up the good work and looking forward to seeing where this game goes!!

I foresee some of the competitive PVPers getting extremely frustrated just trying to land hits on an opponent...although I did see a guy get baited into digging up a carrot only to be stabbed in the top of the head by a farmer about 20 times.

Apologies to the developers, as I'm certain you will be reading this; the game looks beautiful and I hope to return at some point to really have fun in this game.

There are just too many fundamental things that seem to have been overlooked in favor of just having a pretty game taking advantage of the UE4 engine. Great job to the Art Team.

The Black Death in itself is a great concept for a survival MMO, however there are several flaws in the way it plays.

Granted, it is an early access so bugs and problems are to be expected, such as the low frame rate I experienced, however the problem that put me off this game (Albeit for the time being) is that there is a reccuring loop where you are unable to interact with anything after a short period of time which is only fixed by restarting the game.

Once restarted, you can log back in with your character, the items and money you had accumulated but not any of the experience or skills. This means you have to start the gathering/ killing process all over again just to have the game stop leting you interact with the world once more, forcing a reset and putting you back to square one.

While I see this game having a lot of potential in the future, until this issue is adressed the game is not worth the current ¬£14 asking price. I will however be watching this game to see how it develops.

Edit: It is worth noting that this could be down to server issues, since it has only just been released and may well be fixed in the next few hours.

Early Access Review

Edit to the below review:
So far it has been a few weeks since the release - the dev's have put out a couple of large fixes - but a fraction of what is needed - I can no longer recommend this game in it's current state until a number of the glaring bugs have been fixed

As far as early release Alpha games go, this isn't the worst;
Graphically, this is where the games strong point is - the landscape and towns have great textures and its overall well optimised. The style of game will favour those that enjoy Life is Feudal or reign of kings, buts it's really to early to tell how it will develop. The concept and role of the players seems very promising

There are  alot of bugs -- every playthrough so far (about 8 logins) have resulted in the game crashing or becoming unstable -- there are floating objects, the sounds crash, crafting crash, looting

For it's price however, it is better than other alpha's I've played for more, which did pan out to be terrific games, so it gets a recommendation from me -- if in a month's time, nothings changed - then it'll get a thumbs down
